Event.0: Prince Albert II, the only son of Prince Rainier III and Grace Kelly, formally assumed the throne of Monaco.
Event.1: FIFA World Cup Final, Stade de France, Saint-Denis: Zinadine Zidane scores twice as France wins first World Cup beating Brazil, 3-0
Event.2:
Malala Yousafzai
Pakistani activist
was born
Event.3:
Geraldine Ferraro designated running mate of Walter Mondale
Democratic presidential candidate Walter F. Mondale put forward Geraldine Ferraro as his running mate on this day in 1984, making her the first woman ever nominated for vice president by a major U.S. political party.
Event.4: 1st "Family Feud" game show debuts on ABC hosted by Richard Dawson
Event.5: The island nation of Sao Tome and Principe was granted independence from Portugal.
Event.7: US Surgeon General Leroy Burney connects smoking with lung cancer
Event.8: World War II: Battle of Prokhorovka - Russians defeat German forces in one of the largest ever tank battles
Event.9:
Bill Cosby
American entertainer and producer
was born
Event.10: The independent republic of Lithuania, having successfully expelled invading Soviet troops, signed a peace treaty with Russia.
Event.11: Artist Pablo Picasso (36) marries ballet dancer Olga Khokhlova (27)
Event.12: 150,000 Ulstermen gather and resolve to resist Irish Home Rule by force of arms; since the British Liberals have promised the Irish nationalists Home Rule, civil war appears imminent
Event.13:
Pablo Neruda
Chilean poet
was born
Event.14: Chilean poet, diplomat, and politician Pablo Neruda, perhaps the most important Latin American poet of the 20th century and the winner of the 1971 Nobel Prize for Literature, was born in Parral.
Event.15:
R. Buckminster Fuller
American engineer, architect, and futurist
was born
Event.16: Italian painter and sculptor Amedeo Modigliani, whose portraits are among the most important of the 20th century, was born.
Event.17: In New Zealand, British forces invade Waikato, home of the Maori King Movement, beginning a new phase of the wars between Maori and Colonial British
Event.18: The Medal of Honor, awarded for battlefield bravery, was created for the U.S. Army.
Event.19:
Henry David Thoreau
American writer
was born
Event.20: Former United States Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton dies after being shot in a pistol duel by Vice President Aaron Burr
Event.21: French Revolution: The Civil Constitution of the Clergy is adopted, putting the Catholic Church in France under the control of the state
Event.22: Battle of Boyne: in Ireland, Protestant King William III defeats English Catholic King James II
Event.23: Britain's King Charles II ratifies Habeas Corpus Act allowing prisoners right to be imprisoned to be examined by a court
Event.24: King Henry VIII of England wed his sixth and last wife, Catherine Parr.
Event.25: England's King Henry VIII weds Catherine Parr (6th & last wife)
Event.26: Richard Plantagenet, Duke of Gloucester and later King of England, marries Anne Neville, daughter of the Earl of Warwick, in Westminster Abbey.
